run.lit: Basic system up and running in the data center

A user has started a discovery (or it has been kicked off by a calendar). They want to see the status of the discovery and any possible errors that come up during the discovery process. This information should be presented via the common alarm and event manager window.

task.title: Showing Link Information on Graphic Map

run.lit: A user has been running discovery for a while and would like to see the topology information. They can create a view that limits by location (or any other selection factor that is in the system) what they want to see. Imagine a campus network with core and distribution routers. The user would like to see just the network components and the interconnecting links. Just as a user can select a Device to drill down into (see the contained service elements) they can also drill down on a link to see, if there are vlans on the link or other InterDeviceLinks like CDP or VRRP.

run.lit: User installable instance of Integer

task.title: Viewing network and Service element details on the UI

run.lit: Users can see details of Service Elements that have been selected in Filters as well as in reports. For example, expanding out the network interfaces in a router. They will also be able to list all devices on the screen and individually select service elements for expansion.
Part of the information that a user can select is the discovery status of a ServiceElement
This same function works for network details and navigating up/down the topology layers.

task.title: Viewing Reports and ad hoc export of data

run.lit: The user will be able to select which report (s) to view what to print, export and send in mail.
Any report should be able to be filtered by an existing filter.

We want users to be able to create, modify and delete selections (selections contain: filters, views and layers – see documentation). We want them be able to list selections and to cause their exectuion with results on the screen, in reports or other export functions - accomplished by the view portion of the selection. That also controls whether the information is graphically displayed or in table form.
In first release all filters and views are per[user] group.

task.title: Create a multi-subnet service element and topology discovery and run

run.lit: The user wants an extended service element and layer 2/3 topology discovery of most of the environment that has many subnets. There are certain types of devices they want to include and others to exclude.
If needed the TopologyElement and Path objects may be delayed from the previous simple service element on a single subnet story until this one.
At this point the user is not controlling the configuration, it is set. Controlling the configuration of the discovery system is in the next story.

task.title: Simple Service Element Discovery on a single subnet

run.lit: The idea is to do our first function end to end. After the user logs in, they will be able to start a discovery on a single subnet and find all the devices there. This will also include full service element discovery.

This requires the implemenation of the SnmpVendorDiscoveryTemplate, ServiceElementDiscoveryManager, ServiceElementDiscoveryPolicy, SnmpVendorContainmentSelector, SnmpServiceElementRelationship, SnmpContainment, SnmpServiceElementTypeDiscriminator and SnmpLevelOID objects. It will also require the basic implementation of the Topology since that is how discovery stars and the IpTopologySeed.
In addition to the ServiceElement and ServiceElementType implemenations required, the ServiceElementAccessManager must also be implemented to configure access (community strings) for devices.
This will also include implemenation of the ServiceElementProtocolInstanceIdentifier.

task.title: A full set of deployment and configuration instructions

run.lit: We need a full set of deployment and configuration instructions for Integer.

The user would like a periodic report (a single report instance is also possible) that lists the entire 'inventory' in the system as of a specified date. They will be able to select the fields they would like included for each Service Element, Types of Service Elements, including listing them in a way that includes child Service Elements like disks etc and interfaces. This will also show the parent chiled relationship(s).
For now, this report will also be exportable in JSON format.

The general case is that a user would like periodic reports of information in the system that may change over time. In this case, they are interested in getting a report every 24 hours of the Service Elements that have changed since the last report was run (it may not always be the case that report interval is the same as the time interval to report on). The report rules are defined by the Policy and Inventory Handling parameters in a selected policy.
The InventoryManager must be implemented for this story.

task.title: Creating and managing topology and service element discovery policies

run.lit: A user has set up discovery and it is running periodically. They have not yet set up any policies about what to do when new systems are discovered, changed, or missing. They wish to set up policies that tell the system what to do in all these cases as well as define some rules about when a system is deemed changed, missing or new.
If needed we can delay the implemenation of the ImsSchedulingManager and Calendar and CalendarPolicy in this release.

The system has just been deployed and the user would like to set up a general discovery by defining the subnets, hops from the seed subnets to search, default community strings for SNMP and their priority on a global and per subnet basis, and which Service Element Types to exclude from the discovery.
They are also able to control the technologies used in the topology discovery and what to look for in the ServiceElementDiscovery phase.

task.title: Maintain Users, groups, and access policies and Contact information

run.lit: Allows operators to create new users, change their roles and reset password or disable/delete user. For those users that are externally authenticated such as with CAS, there will be no password.
Classes included in this work are Organization, AuthNInfo, Contact, User, Role, Access Policy and CalendarPolicy.
Also required is the UserContactAndRoleManager.
In some cases, a few operators will have 'root' access to integer. These users will be permitted to log into the system without and external authentication system like CAS.
Implementing this first also gives us a way to get started with the system. It requires some amount of implementation of users etc. This will only implement as much as is needed.

task.title: Integrate LDAP Attribute Service while using CAS
Integrate CAS plug-in and software into our System
User Access via CAS and LDAP -

run.lit: User is able to log into the Integer system using both CAS for authentication and LDAP as an attribute service.

A user sits at their web browser and types in the the home page URL for Integer. The request is redirected by the server to our CAS server for authentication, and optionally the LDAP repository is queried for attributes like first and last name.

task.title: Write installation/verification software that conforms to security recommendations

run.lit: Based on the system security requirements, write installation software that checks for conformance to these requirements and informs user of variation with actions to take based on the recommendations.

task.title: Identify and document correct system security configuration for the Integer OD

run.lit: We want to identify what the correct security stance should be for an Integer installation. That is, what ports should be open, requirements for keys. This includes inter and intra system communication.

After the system has been set up and initial information entered, the systems operator will want to be able to control various aspects of the system behavior. These include, distributed component control, start/stop discovery and reporting. This is a basic set for the first release.

task.title: associate the basic service element type designed by loren

run.lit: After receiving stop command, the discovery manager should not make any new requests to devices.
